DOC.detailed_description: To conduct double-blinded , placebo-controlled , randomize intervention study investigate whether mineralocorticoid receptor ( MR ) antagonism , alone combination cinacalcet , effective therapy primary hyperparathyroidism ( P-HPTH ) . Hypothesis : MR antagonism , monotherapy combination calcimimetic , mechanism lower parathyroid hormone ( PTH ) primary hyperparathyroidism ( P-HPTH ) . Study Design : Sixty subject P-HPTH enrol randomly receive eplerenone ( potassium-sparing diuretic directly block MR ) , amiloride ( potassium-sparing diuretic directly block MR ) , placebo 4 week . Thereafter , subject receive cinacalcet therapy ( calcimimetic lower PTH ) addition randomize intervention additional 2 week . Anticipated Results : In proof-of-concept study , eplerenone therapy lower PTH , serum calcium , marker bone resorption P-HPTH , compare placebo . The PTH response amiloride resemble placebo , suggest eplerenone mediate reduction PTH specific interaction MR . Combination therapy eplerenone + cinacalcet result additive synergistic reduction PTH , compare placebo + cinacalcet placebo + amiloride . Implications : MR antagonism ( alone combination cinacalcet ) may mechanism low PTH calcium P-HPTH , thereby identify new potential option limit medical therapy P-HPTH .
